content.description: A split ticket is a voting pattern in which a voter casts votes for candidates from more than one political party. In a recent study, 1,000 men and women were asked whether they voted a split ticket in the last election. The totals are shown in the following table.
content.question: Men Women Total Yes, split ticket <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> 600 No, did not split ticket <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> 400 Total 800 200 1,000 What value of <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> would indicate no association between gender and voting pattern for the people in the sample?

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
